IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Directory attributes of /sbin modified (ATT&CK T1222.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in attributes of the /sbin directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to select the directory attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Attributes of system32 directory modified (ATT&CK T1222)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when system directory, %WINDIR%\system32 attributes have changed. For additional information, see the Details tab
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to select directory attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /usr/bin and /usr/sbin directories modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in file attributes in any file under '/usr/bin' and '/usr/sbin' path. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options so additional file attributes can be monitored.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File permissions in the /var/log directory modified (ATT&CK T1222.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
Adversaries may modify permissions to access to log files and with appropriate permissions can delete the activity/attack logs to evade the detection. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration options are provided to exclude certain files and directories.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - 'Hosts' file modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in file attributes of Windows 'Hosts' file. For additional information, see the Details tab.
The rule also provides configuration options to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Network configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in file attributes of Network configuration files found under %WINDIR%\inf (e.g., C:\WINDOWS\inf) directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to exclude files from monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Startup Programs Modified (ATT&CK T1060, T1112)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in file attributes of user Startup programs located under Profiles directories. The rule also monitors directory permissions of Startup Programs found under Profiles directory and modifications in the registries entries created by the Startup Programs and Winlogon.
The rule provides configuration options to select file attributes to monitor and also to enter files to ignore monitoring which were located under %ProfilesDir%\username\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - System configuration file modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is change in attributes of system configuration files. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Also the rule provides configuration option to ignore files monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - System .dll or .exe files modified (ATT&CK T1036.003, T1222.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in .dll or .exe files under %WINDIR%\system32 path. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: This rule provides configuration option to ignore files for monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - System File Modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is change in attributes of system files like boot.ini, ntldr, autorun.inf, files with com, exe, bat, ocx, pif, sys extension located under %SystemDrive% (e.g. C:) directory. By default we ignore monitoring pagefile.sys and hiberfil.sys files.
Also the rule provides configuration option to ignore files for monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Installed software attributes modified (ATT&CK T1195.002, T1554)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in attributes of installed software or program attributes. Also it alerts when a program is installed or uninstalled on windows host. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Also the rule provides configuration options to ignore monitoring software and to select the InstalledSoftware and RegistryKey attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Attributes of services modified (ATT&CK T1036.004, T1543.003)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule is intended to alert when attributes of certain services are modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to ignore monitoring services.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Default Debugger changed
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when registry data values for Windows default debugger have changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Microsoft hotfixes registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1112)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when attributes of registry subkeys changed where Windows Hotfix updates found. It monitors all registry keys where Hotfix entries gets updated in Windows Registry. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to choose registry key attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Registry values of event log modified (ATT&CK T1070.001, T1562.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when attributes of registry subkeys and data values changed for settings of Windows Event Viewer. For additional information, see the Details tab.
The rule also provides configuration options to choose registry key and value attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - 'ActiveX Compatibility' registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1112)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when there is any change in the 'ActiveX Compatibility' registry key set. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - WarFTPD
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by WarFTPD were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Apache HTTP Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Apache were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Apache Tomcat
IntegrityRule.Description:
This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Tomcat were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.
Note: This rule should be applied on windows systems only.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - LSA Authentication Packages modified (ATT&CK T1547.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in the data of the Authentication Packages value of the Local Security Authority (LSA) registry key. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: "Authentication Packages" lists the user authentication package that is loaded and called when users attempt to log on to Windows.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - SAM registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1098, T1136)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when there is a change in registry key entries where SAM Domain Account User's details found. When a user is added to the local system, new registry keys are added under the SAM Domain Account registry path. Generally, these registry entries contain user details like login name, user number, sid name, machine name etc. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - DNS Server (ATT&CK T1554, T1584.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by DNS Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Software installed, updated or removed
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when software is installed or uninstalled on the target host. The rule monitors software which is registered using RPM packages on Linux and pkginfo on Solaris. For additional information, see the Details tab

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - WS_FTP
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by WS_FTP were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - 3CDaemon
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by 3CDaemon were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Microsoft IIS
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by IIS were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - NettermFTP
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by NettermFTP were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - ARCserve Backup
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys/services created by CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Microsoft SQL Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Microsoft SQL Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - MySQL
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by MYSQL were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Trend Micro Deep Security Agent / Relay
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Deep Security Agent / Relay were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.
On windows, the rule look into any change made to installedSoftware, files, directories, registry and services.
On Unix, it monitors installedSoftware, files, directories and process changes.
The rule also provides interface to configure installation file path.
Note: onChange feature will not work for the DirectorySet entity set in this rule.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Trend Micro Deep Security Manager
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Deep Security Manager were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - MDaemon Email Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys/services created by MDaemon have been changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - MailEnable
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by MailEnable were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Microsoft Exchange
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Microsoft Exchange Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - IBM Lotus Domino
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by IBM Lotus Domino were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Trend Micro OfficeScan client
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Trend Micro OfficeScan Client were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Oracle Database Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys/services created by Oracle Database Server have been changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Merak Mail Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Merak were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Novell eDirectory
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Novell eDirectory were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - PostgreSQL
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates files/directories/registry keys/services created by PostgreSQL have been changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - VMware Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by VMWare Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Active Directory
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in directory attributes and file attributes of all files found in %WINDIR%\system32\NTDS and %WINDIR%\system32\SYSVOL directories. It monitors change in registry keys and data values created by Microsoft Active Directory.
The rule also provides configuration options to select file attributes to monitor and to provide file names to ignore monitoring files under %WINDIR%\system32\NTDS and %WINDIR%\system32\SYSVOL directories.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Sun ONE Application Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Sun ONE Application Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Sun ONE Directory Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files created by Sun ONE were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - IBM WebSphere Application Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services created by IBM WebSphere Application Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Oracle Bea WebLogic Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files created by Oracle Bea WebLogic Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Listening ports modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when there is any change in listening ports with change in users owning these ports and protocol details. The rule also provides configuration options to choose user names, port numbers and/or protocol names to monitor. For additional information, see the Details tab. Note: The rule is supported on Linux platforms only.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Process attributes modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in any process attributes such as CommandLine, Group, Path, Process, User, Parent, Threads.
By default, we do not monitor any process since the change in PID of the process may create many alerts. Hence the rule provides configuration options to include processes to monitor and to select process attributes to monitor.For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - IBM DB2
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys/services created by IBM DB2 Database Server(for windows) have been changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Ingres Database Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services created by Ingres Database Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - IBM Tivoli Directory Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services created by IBM Tivoli Directory Server on windows were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Kerberos
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by Kerberos have been modified. This could also indicate the software was installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Samba
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / processes created by Samba were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - mountd
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by mountd have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - NFS
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes related to NFS have been created or modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Configuration files of sendmail utility modified
IntegrityRule.Description: Rule monitors files of sendmail utility. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - vixie-cron
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services created by vixie-cron were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Portmapper
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts on any change in file, folders or processes related to Portmapper. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Network Information Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by Network Information Server have been modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - rstatd
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alert indicates that the files / process / services created by rstatd were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - IPSwitch iMail
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by IPSwitch iMail Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Exim
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files created by Exim were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - DHCP server files directory and service modified (ATT&CK T1036.003, T1222.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by DHCP Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: This rule provides configuration option to monitor files in custom installation directory.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - OpenSSL
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by OpenSSL were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - telnetd
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/services created by telnetd have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - PHP
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys created by PHP have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Postfix
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / processes created by Postfix were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Squid Proxy
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services / registry keys created by Squid were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Mailman
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / processes created by Mailman were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Xorg-x / XFree86 / Xfree86 / Xorg-x11
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by Xorg-x / XFree86 / Xfree86 / Xorg-x11 have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - VNC Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by VNC Server have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - CacheFS
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/processes created by CacheFS have been modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - vsftpd
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / services created by FTP server, vsftpd were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - WU-FTPD
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys created by WU-FTPD were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /etc directory modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in attributes of any file under /etc directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to select the file attributes that should be monitored and also paths to ignore. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so exceptions should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /lib directory modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in attributes of any file under /lib directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to select the file attributes that should be monitored and also paths to ignore. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so exceptions should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - System driver files modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in file attributes Created, LastModified, Permissions, Owner, Group, Size and Contents of .sys files under %WINDIR%\system32\drivers path.
Also the rule provides configuration option to ignore files for monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - OpenSSH (ATT&CK T1021.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files/registry keys/services created by OpenSSH have been changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /bin directory modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in file attributes in any file under /bin path. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to select the file attributes that should be monitored and also paths to ignore. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so exceptions should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /sbin directory modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in file attributes in any file under /sbin path. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to select the file attributes that should be monitored and also paths to ignore. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so exceptions should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Directory attributes of /bin modified (ATT&CK T1222.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is any change in attributes of the /bin directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule also provides configuration options to select the directory attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Trend Micro OfficeScan Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Trend Micro OfficeScan Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Threat - Suspicious Microsoft Windows Files Detected
IntegrityRule.Description: This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Threat - Suspicious Microsoft Windows Registry Entries Detected
IntegrityRule.Description: This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific registry entity is created or modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes modified (ATT&CK T1070.002, T1222.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
Adversaries may modify permissions on files to gain additional access, hide evidence of an intrusion or to clear their tracks. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to add files for monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Attributes of log file modified (ATT&CK T1070, T1222.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in any file attributes for a given log file on Windows platform. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to add files for monitoring and to select the file attributes to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - AutoRun Registry Entries Modified (ATT&CK T1013, T1060)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when there is any change in the AutoRun registry entries.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Apache Hadoop
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the directories, files and processes created by Apache Hadoop (for non-windows) have been changed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Task scheduler entries modified (ATT&CK T1053.005)
IntegrityRule.Description: An adversary may use job scheduling to execute programs at system startup or on a scheduled basis for persistence, to conduct execution as part of lateral movement, to gain root privileges, or to run a process under the context of a specific account. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Threat - Suspicious Microsoft Windows Superfish Detected
IntegrityRule.Description: This generic rule is intended to alert when highly malicious superfish adware specific file or registry entity is created or modified and a superfish adware process is started or stopped. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0012: Suspicious Files Detected In Temporary Directories (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0013: Suspicious Files Detected In Windows Folder (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0008: Suspicious Directories Detected In Program Files Folder
IntegrityRule.Description:
Monitoring Program files folder for suspicious directories creation with specific keyword string matching in name.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0016: Suspicious Running Processes Detected (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific running processes.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0015: Suspicious Service Detected (ATT&CK T1543.003)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific service detected.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0017: Microsoft Windows - SAM Domain Account Users Modification Detected (ATT&CK T1098, T1136)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when modification detected in SAM domain account users.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0011: Suspicious Files Detected In System Folder
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0007: Suspicious Files Detected In Application Directories (ATT&CK T1574.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0006: Suspicious Files Detected In Application Directories
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0005: Suspicious Files Detected In Application Directories (ATT&CK T1562.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0014: Suspicious Service Detected (ATT&CK T1543.003)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific service detected.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0002: Suspicious Files Detected In Operating System Directories (ATT&CK T1053.005)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0004: Suspicious Files Detected In Operating System Directories
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when a highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0003: Suspicious Files Detected In Operating System Directories (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0001: Suspicious Files Detected In Operating System Directories (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0010: Suspicious Files Detected In System Folder (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0009: Suspicious Files Detected In System Folder (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0018: Suspicious Files Detected In User Profile Directory (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when a highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0019: Suspicious Files Detected In System Drivers Directory (ATT&CK T1014)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0020: Suspicious Directories Detected In System Drive
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific directory entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0021: Suspicious Files Detected In System Drive (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0022: Suspicious Files Detected In Recycle Bin (ATT&CK T1560.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0023: Suspicious Changes In NTLM Settings (ATT&CK T1547.005)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific registry entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0024: Suspicious Files Detected In C Drive
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: TMTR-0026: Suspicious Files Detected In Program Files Folder
IntegrityRule.Description:
This generic rule is intended to alert when highly suspicious malware specific file entity is created or modified.
This rule is applicable to Windows platforms.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - chrony
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / process created by chrony were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - USB storage device detected (ATT&CK T1052.001, T1092)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when a USB storage device is plugged in the system. It monitors the changes in registry key to detect the attachment and removal of USB storage device. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Docker
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule is intended to monitor the changes related to Docker files on the Docker host. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Threat - WannaCry
IntegrityRule.Description: This is intended to alert when ransomware WannaCry related entities like file/directory, registry, service was created or modified.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - File attributes in the /usr/etc, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /usr/libexec And /usr/local directories modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in file attributes under monitored directories. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration options to select the file attributes that should be monitored and also paths to ignore. It has the potential to monitor a large number of files and also generate large number of events and so exceptions should be configured carefully.

IntegrityRule.Name: Threat - BADRABBIT
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule is intended to alert when ransomware BADRABBIT related files and registries were created or modified. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Users and Groups - Create and Delete Activity (ATT&CK T1136)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule detects creation and deletion of users and groups. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration option is provided to exclude users and groups to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Kubernetes Cluster master
IntegrityRule.Description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Kubernetes Cluster node
IntegrityRule.Description: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications. This rule is for monitoring Kubernetes Nodes.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Powershell activity detected (ATT&CK T1059.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the execution of the PowerShell, along with PowerShell execution policy registry key, and the WinRM service. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - bash non-root user configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can insert code into the files listed in the details tab to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Accessibility features registry keys or files modified (ATT&CK T1546.008, T1546.012)
IntegrityRule.Description:
An adversary can modify the way these programs are launched to get a command prompt or backdoor without logging into the system. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: This rule provides configuration option to select files for monitoring.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - AppInit DLL Registry values modified (ATT&CK T1546.010)
IntegrityRule.Description: The monitored registry values can be used and abused by adversaries to obtain persistence and privilege escalation by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - AppCert DLL Registry values modified (ATT&CK T1546.009)
IntegrityRule.Description: Dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are specified in the AppCertDLLs value in the Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager are loaded into every process that calls various ubiquitously used application programming interface (API) functions. This value can be abused to obtain persistence and privilege escalation by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - NetSh Helper DLL Registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1546.007)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can use netsh.exe with helper DLLs to proxy execution of arbitrary code in a persistent manner when netsh.exe is executed automatically with another persistence technique or if other persistent software is present on the system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Application shimming detected (ATT&CK T1546.011)
IntegrityRule.Description:
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.
However, certain shims can be abused. Utilizing these shims may allow an adversary to perform several malicious acts such as elevate privileges, install backdoors, disable defenses like Windows Defender, etc. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - bash command history cleared (ATT&CK T1059.004)
IntegrityRule.Description:
Adversaries can use a variety of methods to clear command history, clearing their tracks. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: By default this rule only monitors root command history. Additional users to monitor can be added under Configuration Options in the Configuration tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Service Registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1574.011)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can change the service binPath/ImagePath to point to a different executable under their control. When the service starts or is restarted, then the adversary-controlled program will execute, allowing the adversary to gain persistence and/or privilege escalation to the account context the service is set to execute under (local/domain account, SYSTEM, LocalService, or NetworkService). For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Time Provider Registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1547.003)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse this architecture to establish persistence, specifically by registering and enabling a malicious DLL as a time provider. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Port Monitors (ATT&CK T1547.010)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors a registry key that the print spooler users to monitor printer ports. Adversaries can use this technique to load malicious code at startup that will persist on system reboot and execute as SYSTEM. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Root Certificate Registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1553.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Installation of a root certificate on a compromised system would give an adversary a way to degrade the security of that system. Adversaries have used this technique to avoid security warnings prompting users when compromised systems connect over HTTPS to adversary controlled web servers that spoof legitimate websites in order to collect login credentials. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Removable Device Detected (ATT&CK T1092)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can perform command and control between compromised hosts on potentially disconnected networks using removable media to transfer commands from system to system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Component Object Model Registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1546.015)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can use this system to insert malicious code that can be executed in place of legitimate software through hijacking the COM references and relationships as a means for persistence. Hijacking a COM object requires a change in the Windows Registry to replace a reference to a legitimate system component which may cause that component to not work when executed. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Application - Trend Micro ApexOne Server
IntegrityRule.Description: This alert indicates that the files / registry keys / services created by Trend Micro Apex One Server were modified. This could indicate that the software was updated or installed / uninstalled.

IntegrityRule.Name: Vulnerability - Trend Micro Apex One And OfficeScan Directory Traversal Vulnerability (CVE-2019-9489)
IntegrityRule.Description: Alert(s) of this IM rule indicates that CVE-2019-9489 is being exploited. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Vulnerability - SaltStack Vulnerabilities Exploitation Detected
IntegrityRule.Description: Alert(s) of this IM rule indicates that SaltStack vulnerabilities are being exploited. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - LSA Notification Packages modified (ATT&CK T1556.002)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when there is a change in the data of the Notification Packages value of the Local Security Authority (LSA) registry key. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: "Notification Packages" specifies the dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are loaded or called when passwords are set or changed.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Systemd service modified (ATT&CK T1543.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors changes systemd services. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Windows Command Shell activity detected (ATT&CK T1059.003)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the execution of the command prompt. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Process running from the /tmp and /var/tmp directories detected (ATT&CK T1543)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule alerts when there is a process initiated from "/tmp/ and /var/tmp/" directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SCP process detected (ATT&CK T1048.001, T1105)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule alerts when the SCP process is executed. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration options are provided to exclude monitoring of the SCP process if it was executed by certain user or group.

IntegrityRule.Name: Vulnerability - Trend Micro ServerProtect For Linux Command Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2020-24561)
IntegrityRule.Description: Alert(s) of this IM rule indicates that CVE-2020-24561 is being exploited. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Task scheduler entries modified (ATT&CK T1053)
IntegrityRule.Description:
An adversary may use job scheduling to execute programs at system startup or on a scheduled basis for persistence, to conduct execution as part of lateral movement, to gain root privileges or to run a process under the context of a specific account. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration option are provided to exclude certain tasks and directories, and to disable the monitoring for cron jobs processes.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Shared object files modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors shared object (.so) files in the /lib, /lib32 and /lib64 directories. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Local user and group files modified (ATT&CK T1136.001, T1531)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors changes in files that store account details like password hash and group. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - runtime linker configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the dynamic linker used to load libraries. It will not get assigned by a recommendation scan. It should be assigned only to hosts where the monitored files do not change outside a maintenance window. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - System wide environment variables and startup scripts modified (ATT&CK T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors files that set the environment variables at startup of the Bash shell and contains other scripts that contain application-specific startup files, which are also executed at startup time by the shell. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - bash configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1059.004, T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse Unix shells to execute various commands or payloads or establish persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - List of valid login shells modified (ATT&CK T1059.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the list of valid login shells. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Name resolver configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1071.004, T1583.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the configuration files which are responsible for DNS resolution. This rule will not get assigned by a recommendation scan. It should be assigned only to hosts where the monitored files do not change outside a maintenance window. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - PAM configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1068)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may modify PAM configuration files to perform privilege escalation. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Samba configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1135)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors Samba configuration files. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Run control (rc) scripts modified (ATT&CK T1037.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the rc scripts for changes. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - xinetd configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the files inside "/etc/xinetd.d/" directory, which contains the configuration files for each service managed by xinetd. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Alternative commands modified (ATT&CK T1036)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors files in "/etc/alternatives" directory that is used to keep track of the alternatives currently in use, by a tool called update-alternatives. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Software repository modified (ATT&CK T1195.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may manipulate the package repository list for the purpose of compromising data or the system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - adduser, useradd and deluser configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1136.001, T1531)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may manipulate the default configuration of "adduser", "useradd" and "deluser" commands for the persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - dhclient configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the configuration files of dhclient utility. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - csh/tcsh configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1059.004, T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse Unix shells to execute various commands or payloads or establish persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - zsh configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1059.004, T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse Unix shells to execute various commands or payloads or establish persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Core system configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule monitors core system files for any changes. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration options are provided to exclude certain files and directories under /etc/sysconfig directory.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Name of the local system modified (ATT&CK T1082)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors "/etc/hostname" file, which stores the system's host name. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Host access control files modified (ATT&CK T1584.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: To determine if a client machine is allowed to connect to a service, TCP wrappers reference host access control files. This rule monitors these control files. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - ftpd configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1048, T1071.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors ftpd configuration files. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Boot loader configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1542)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse Pre-OS Boot mechanisms as a way to establish persistence on a system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Boot files modified (ATT&CK T1542)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors boot process related files in the "/lib" directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - modeprobe configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1547.006)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the configuration files of the modeprobe utility. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Default firewall rules modified (ATT&CK T1562.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors files inside the "/lib/firwalld" directory which holds default firewall rules like default zones and common services. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Disk configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1561.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors files inside the "/lib/hdparm/" directory. This directory contains SATA/IDE parameters for disks to run properly. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSL configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1587.003)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the openssl configuration and SSL certificates inside the "/lib/ssl" directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - User access control files modified (ATT&CK T1068)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the change in files inside the "/lib/security" directory. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Process initialization scripts and configuration files modified (ATT&CK 1037)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may use scripts automatically executed at boot or logon initialization to establish persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Vulnerability - Microsoft Exchange - HAFNIUM Targeted Vulnerabilities
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitor IOCs related to the Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities - CVE-2021-26855, CVE-2021-26857, CVE-2021-26858 & CVE-2021-27065 - by HAFNIUM group. Triggers of this rule indicate probable exploitation. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Static boot loader files modified (ATT&CK T1542)
IntegrityRule.Description: The "/boot" directory contains the files needed to boot the system. Adversaries may abuse Pre-OS Boot mechanisms as a way to establish persistence on a system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - sudo files modified (ATT&CK T1548.003)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors sudo files. Adversaries may use these files to perform sudo caching and/or use the suoders file to elevate privileges. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Network services configuration files modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the network services configuration files. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Kernel configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1547.006)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may modify the kernel to automatically execute programs on system boot. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Internet routing information file modified
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors "etc/gateways" file which specify Internet routing information to routed daemon. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - FTP client process initiated (ATT&CK T1048)
IntegrityRule.Description: Exfiltration can be done using ftp operating system utility. This rule monitors the ftp process initiated on the host system. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - bash root user configuration files modified (ATT&CK T1546.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries can insert code into the files listed in the details tab to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Security support providers (SSP) registry key modified (ATT&CK T1547.005)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may abuse security support providers (SSPs) to execute DLLs. These SSP DLLs are loaded into the Local Security Authority (LSA) process at system start. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSH server configuration file modified (ATT&CK T1021.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors ssh server (sshd) configuration file. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSH client configuration modified (ATT&CK1021.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors ssh client configuration file. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Permissions on ssh private host keys modified (ATT&CK T1021.004, T1222.002)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors ssh private host keys. If attacker has a copy of the private host keys, they can perform man-in-the-middle attacks on the network to obtain user passwords and to inject new commands in other administrative sessions. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSH authorized_keys file modified - root user (ATT&CK T1021.004, T1098.004, T1563.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the root account's authorized_keys file. It holds a list of authorized public keys for servers and can be used for password less login. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSH authorized_keys file modified - systemwide (ATT&CK T1021.004, T1098.004, T1563.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors the general authorized_keys file. It holds a list of authorized public keys for servers and can be used for password less login. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - SSH authorized_keys file modified - non-root users (ATT&CK T1021.004, T1098.004, T1563.001)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule monitors the authorized_keys file of configured users. It holds a list of authorized public keys for servers and can be used for password less login. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: The rule provides configuration option to add users to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - OpenSSH registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1021.004, T1112)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors registry keys of OpenSSH server. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - OpenSSH server configuration file modified (ATT&CK T1021.004)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors ssh server (sshd) configuration file. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Users and Groups - Create and Delete Activity (ATT&CK T1136)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule detects creation and deletion of users and groups. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: Configuration option is provided to exclude users and groups to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Kernel modules loading configuration modified (ATT&CK T1547.006)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors "modules_disabled" and "modprobe" files. Adversaries may alter these files to enable the loading of kernel modules. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Windows file protection registry modified (ATT&CK T1112, T1546.008)
IntegrityRule.Description: Windows File Protection (WFP) prevents programs from replacing critical Windows system files. Adversaries may establish persistence by modifying the registry values. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Network services registries modified (ATT&CK T1547.001, T1574.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs. This rule monitors such registry keys which can be used for the persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - AutoRun registries modified (ATT&CK T1547.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or referencing it with a Registry run key. This rule monitors registry keys and values which can be used to set startup folder items for persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Boot or Logon Autostart Execution registries modified (ATT&CK T1547.004, T1547.014)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may modify Winlogon registries to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in or modify registry key to the Active Setup of the local machine for the persistence. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Autostart execution registries modified (ATT&CK T1547.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or referencing it with a Registry run key. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Files in appdata startup folder modified (ATT&CK T1547.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by placing a program within a startup folder. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Files in programdata startup folder modified (ATT&CK T1547.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by placing a program within a startup folder. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Files in start menu directory modified (ATT&CK T1547.001)
IntegrityRule.Description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by placing a program within a startup folder. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Active directory registry keys modified (ATT&CK T1112)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors Active Directory registries keys for the modification. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Microsoft Windows - Active directory files modified (ATT&CK T1552.006)
IntegrityRule.Description:
This rule monitors the active directory files for the modification. For additional information, see the Details tab.
Note: This rule also provides the configuration option to exclude the files to monitor.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Apache Web Server Root Documents Files Modified (ATT&CK T1189)
IntegrityRule.Description: This rule monitors apache web server root documents directory for files modification. For additional information, see the Details tab.

IntegrityRule.Name: Linux/Unix - Apache Web Server Root Documents Directory And Files Modified (ATT&CK T1189)
Microsoft Windows - Suspicious Files Detected in Windows Folder
